questions.question: What is the largest planet in our solar system?
What is the largest moon in our solar system?
questions.incorrectMessage: Jupiter's moon Ganymede is the largest, and it is larger than Mercury!

questions.question: Venus's atmosphere is composed primarily of what?
What are the only planet(s) in our solar system with a regrograde rotation?
questions.CorrectMessage: That's right! Pluto too if you remember when it used to be a planet...
questions.incorrectMessage: Sorry, it's Venus and Uranus. Pluto, too, if you remember when it used to be a planet...

questions.question: What was the only probe to pass by Neptune and Uranus?
questions.incorrectMessage: No, it was Voyager 2 which did a flyby of Uranus in 1986 and Neptune in 1989.
questions.correctMessage: That's right! Voyager 2 did a flyby of Uranus in 1986 and Neptune in 1989.

questions.question: What was the first probe to fly by Mercury?
How long is a Martian day?
questions.incorrectAnswer: Sorry, that's wrong. A Martian day is 24 hours and 37 minutes.
questions.correctMessage: You got it even without the 37 extra minutes of sleep!

questions.question: What planet has the longest year?
questions.incorrectAnswer: No, it's Neptune with a year that lasts just under 165 Earth years.
questions.correctMessage: You got it! With it's relatively short day of 16 hours a Neptune year has almost 90,000 days. That's more than 12,000 Fridays.

questions.question: What planet has the shortest day?
questions.incorrectAnswer: Despite being the biggest planet, Jupiter has the fastest rotational period. A day is less than 10 hours.
questions.correctMessage: That's right! At less than 10 hours, Jupiter's day is the shortest in our solar system.

questions.question: What is the most common element in Jupiter's atmosphere?
questions.incorrectAnswer: Nope. Actually, all the gas giants have atmospheres composed primarily of hydrogen.

messages.perfect: If I google planetary science will I find your name?
messages.terrible: Hope you learned something about the planets!
